ES

Naasón Joaquín García

Apostle of JesusChrist

▾ Bio

The Apostle of JesusChrist, Naasón Joaquín García, current International Director of the Light of the World church, was born May 7 1969, in the city of Guadalajara, Jalisco. As a child of the late Apostle Samuel Joaquín Flores and wife Eva García López, he is the fifth of eight children procreated by the marriage. He lived his infant and adolescent years in his hometown of Hermosa Provincia (Beautiful Province).

From his teenage years onward, the Apostle Naasón Joaquín experienced the satisfaction that comes from offering service to God.

▸ In 1983, at the age of 14, he took his first step in his profession of faith: he was baptized in the name of JesusChrist.
▸ In the following years, while still in his adolescence, along with other youth, he integrated himself to the Group of Laborers of the Beautiful Province, where he developed his evangelizational work while in the provinces of the Zona Metropolitana of Guadalajara.
▸ Similarly, during the mid eighties, he accompanied a group of missionaries that were located in the country of Spain. His time spent in the Iberian peninsula , which included giving testimony of the Christian faith throughout the homes and plazas , became an experience that would be forever recorded in his memory.
▸ Another blessing that he experienced was, without a doubt, having accompanied his father, the Apostle Samuel Joaquín, in trips within the Mexican Republic and abroad.
▸ At the age of 17, brother Naasón Joaquín assumes his first responsibility: the Apostle Samuel Joaquín places him in charge of the younger group of teenagers in the church of the Beautiful Province, on August 25 1986.
▸ Subsequently, on May 10 1992, he was placed in charge of the older youth group , and on June 14 of that same year, he married sister Alma Zamora Espinoza, in Guadalajara, with whom he engendered three children: Adoraim, Eldai and Sibma.

In his 28 year trajectory of pastoral work, he was in charge of the following congregations from December 1992 to December 2014:
Phoenix and Tucson, AZ; Huntington Park, CA; Southern Los Ángeles, CA; Santa María, CA; Los Ángeles, CA; San Diego, CA; Santa Ana, CA.

During the course of his work as a minister, he was anointed as Deacon Evangelist (1994), and later Pastor Evangelist (2000).

Alongside his work as pastor, the Apostle Naasón Joaquín devotedly took on other responsibilities: he was director of the Northern Jurisdiction of the Light of the World church (2003-2014), which included the states of Baja California, Baja California South, Sonora, Chihuahua, Nuevo León and Tamaulipas, in which he took on the supervision and care of the spiritual and material needs of the congregations within said demarcations.

With the purpose of promoting the spread of the Christian doctrine through mediums of communication, the Apostle Naasón Joaquín designed and organized “Comunication Center Berea USA” (CCB USA). This instance of media, that began operating in August 2009, besides having a cultural and disseminating focus, is responsible for transmiting video signal of the most relevant events in the Light of the World church −holy suppers, Apostolic presentations , temple inaugurations, biblical studies, etc.− on a global scale.

For reasons of time, I will not expand on the support he gave to the platform of professionals in the neighboring country− The Association of Professionals & Students (APS), nor of the civic service trips in favor of human rights, freedom of beliefs, secular education, and anti-discrimination− which took place in 2007 and 2009 in the northern regions of the Mexican Republic−, nor of his proximity with authorities in education amongst other actions worthy of praise.

December 14 2014

Beginning of his Apostolic ministry

On December 8 2014, at 6:10 in the morning, the Apostle of JesusChrist Samuel Joaquín − who directed the Light of the World church for 50 years, departed to rest with the just. On that day , minutes after his passing, brother Naasón Joaquín searched for a space in one the rooms of his father's house where, afflicted by the situation , he presented a prayer to God: “Console me Lord ! I am in great pain Lord!”. The divine response did not tardy: in that prayer, the Apostle of JesusChrist heard a powerful voice, a voice like thunder, like streams of many waters, that said:

“Why do you ask me for consolation, if your the consolation of my people?… Naasón, you will be in front of this great people; and if you see them numerous today , I will multiply them even more! Honor the body of my servant Samuel and on the following Sunday you will rise to the people… I will open their hearts, and of the Ministral Body as one single man, and I will make the perfect work.
(Cf. Apostolic Letter, December 20 2014, Silao, Gto).

Sunday, December 14 2014 was the appointed day. Similar to the past days, the temple and it's adjacent streets were completely full. In prayer and plea, the church awaited the manifestation of the Apostolic Election. This sublime act, of recongnizing the identity of a Servant of God , was witnessed at 2:43 in the morning. In that instant, the church and the ministers recognized the Apostolic Ministry of brother Naasón Joaquín García, and, unanimously, gave him their allegiance. It is well to mention that this work−of spiritual recognition− is not of human nature, since it procedes from the All Mighty, in accordance with biblical teaching. In his first Apostolic message, that was impreganted with assurance, hope and consolation, he recalled:

“You were not alone, there was only a brief pause . Today is the start of an era of many triumphs, of victory and glory for God. Now that my time has come, I can say with liberty: Naasón Joaquín García, Servant of God and Apostle of JesusChrist”.

The time of dispensation in the church of Christ is still in effect: it's seal of authenticity is the presence of an Apostle. No more no less.

‘Apóstol Naasón Joaquín: Una Semblanza Biográfica,’
author: Humberto García de la Mora
[El Occidental, 3 de enero de 2015, p. 6a].
